title: Sampler, 1812
medium:
Medium: silk and metal thread embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in satin, cross, running, stem, and rococo stitches with figure eight looping on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Mary Hamilton a Daughter of John and Catherine Hamilton was born in County Antrim February the 1 in the year of our Lord 1794 and made this Sampler in Maytown in Miss Welchens School in the year of our Lord 1812
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
1941 - 1970, Emily Coe Stowell
1970, Cooper-Hewitt Museum
creditline: Bequest of Emily Coe Stowell from the Coe Collection
description:
A central oval frame contains a scene of a woman facing a tree, the branches of which break out of the frame. The border is made up of squares containing motifs symmetrically arranged: grape vines, oak branches with acorns, birds in flowering trees, baskets of flowers, ducks in ponds, roses. The center square at the bottom contains the inscription:
Mary Hamilton a Daughter of John and Catherine Hamilton was born in County Antrim February the 1 in the year of our Lord 1794 and made this Sampler in Maytown in Miss Welchens School in the year of our Lord 1812

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1812.
1812. Medium: silk and metal thread embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in satin, cross, running, stem, and rococo stitches with figure eight looping on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Emily Coe Stowell from the Coe Collection. 1970-28-17.
